title: robofleet-dashboard
description: Robofleet-dashboard is a web-based project leveraging JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS to create a dynamic and interactive dashboard. Designed to visualize and manage data related to robotic fleets, this project aims to provide users with an intuitive interface for monitoring robot status, performance metrics, and other key operational information. The dashboard falls under the broader topic of project-based learning and development, offering a practical application of web development technologies in a real-world scenario.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a full-stack project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and MUI, designed as a modern developer dashboard. It leverages React Query for efficient data fetching and caching, providing a streamlined and intuitive interface for managing tasks, tracking progress, and staying organized, demonstrating best practices for building robust web applications with cutting-edge technologies.

title: raven-v2
description: Raven v2 is a project built with TypeScript and JavaScript, focusing on [insert primary function or goal based on README]. It leverages modern web development practices and tools to deliver a [describe key feature or benefit] experience. This repository serves as the central location for development, issue tracking, and community contributions to this project.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project built using TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, showcasing a modern and responsive dashboard implementation using the Next.js framework. This repository serves as a practical example for learning and implementing dashboard UI patterns, data visualization, and server-side rendering with Next.js, providing a foundation for building complex web applications with a focus on performance and user experience.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the TeX source code and generated HTML output for my resume. It serves as a personal project showcasing my skills in creating a professional and customizable resume using LaTeX, along with the ability to convert it into a web-friendly HTML format.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed as a collaborative platform for brainstorming and organizing ideas. This interactive digital whiteboard allows users to easily capture, categorize, and prioritize concepts, fostering a dynamic environment for project planning and innovation. It leverages modern web technologies to provide a user-friendly experience for managing and developing ideas within a team or individually.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a modern, real-time voting application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and CSS, offering a streamlined and intuitive platform for creating and participating in polls. Leveraging the power of Next.js, this project emphasizes performance and scalability while providing a user-friendly interface for various voting scenarios. It showcases best practices in web development and is a practical example of building a full-stack application with a focus on user interaction and data management for collaborative decision-making.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep Debt Tracker is a web application built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML to help users monitor and manage their sleep debt. This project allows users to log their sleep hours, calculate their accumulated sleep debt, and visualize their sleep patterns over time, providing insights for improving sleep habits. The application is focused on practicality and uses modern web technologies for a clean and intuitive user experience.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository contains Jupyter Notebooks and Python code exploring various finance concepts and applications. Focusing on practical projects, it demonstrates how to leverage Python libraries for financial analysis, data visualization, and potentially algorithm development. This serves as a learning resource and a collection of example projects for anyone interested in combining Python with finance.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: This repository showcases an IoT asset tracking application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and styled with Tailwind CSS. Leveraging Supabase for backend services, the project provides a foundation for monitoring and managing physical assets in real-time. It demonstrates a modern approach to web development, combining efficient data management with a responsive and user-friendly interface, serving as a learning resource and starting point for similar IoT projects.

title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: This repository hosts a dynamic event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. It allows users to easily visualize and manage events on a monthly calendar interface. The project focuses on creating a user-friendly and interactive calendar experience, dynamically rendering events and providing functionalities for event creation, viewing, and modification.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a CRUD application built with Python, Flask, and PostgreSQL, providing a platform for managing and interacting with data through Create, Read, Update, and Delete operations. This project demonstrates a practical implementation of web development principles using a combination of HTML, CSS, and Python for the front-end and back-end, along with shell scripting for deployment and management, showcasing a complete Python-based project workflow.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: This project, built with HTML and Python, provides a web-based map visualization tool. It leverages open-source libraries to display geographical data and allows users to explore points of interest, potentially with customizable layers and interactive elements. The repository serves as a practical example of data visualization and web development principles applied to a mapping application.

title: atg-world
description: ATG World is a web-based project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, focused on [mention the project's core functionality, e.g., providing a platform for global communication, visualizing data, or creating interactive experiences]. This repository showcases [mention key features or goals, e.g., a clean user interface, responsive design, or integration with a specific API] and serves as a demonstration of web development best practices.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, CSS, and Shell scripting designed for efficiently visualizing and analyzing log data generated by ROS (Robot Operating System) systems. This project provides a user-friendly interface to filter, search, and explore ROS logs, aiding in debugging and understanding robot behavior. It is intended to streamline the process of inspecting ROS logs, making it easier to identify issues and improve overall system performance.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a full-stack web application built with TypeScript, Vite, and Express.js that leverages the Gemini API to provide engaging and interactive AI-powered conversations. This project demonstrates a modern approach to web development using cutting-edge technologies and explores the possibilities of integrating large language models for dynamic and personalized user experiences.

title: fruit-seller
description: Fruit-seller is a modern e-commerce project built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and leveraging Material UI (MUI) for a responsive and visually appealing user interface. This project showcases best practices for building type-safe applications with React Query for efficient data fetching and management, and serves as a practical example for developers learning to build e-commerce platforms with these technologies.
